sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"赞扬，表扬，称赞"之意。
means: praise ： 普通用词，指用语言或其它方式表示夸奖、赞扬。
applaud ： 指出色的表演或高尚的行为等得到同声赞许、大声叫好或热烈鼓掌。
commend ： 正式用词，指对具体功绩或成就等表示称赞或嘉奖。
compliment ： 侧重客气和礼貌，有时含恭维之意。

sentence.Network_en: I commend Ms. Orth on writing such an informative article.
sentence.Network_cn: 我对奥思太太写出内容如此翔实的文章表示赞许。

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister's initiative has much to commend it.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相的新方案有不少令人赞许之处。

sentence.Network_en: I can commend it to him as a realistic course of action.
sentence.Network_cn: 我可以把这作为一个切实可行的处理方法推荐给他。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)failing to win a prize but nevertheless considered meritorious

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin commendare, from com- (expressing intensive force) + mandare 'commit, entrust'. Compare with command

entry.def: If you commend someone or something, you praise them formally.

example.ex: I commended her for that action...
example.tran: 我赞扬了她的那一举动。

example.ex: I commend Ms. Orth on writing such an informative article...
example.tran: 我对奥思太太写出内容如此翔实的文章表示赞许。

entry.def: If someone commends a person or thing to you, they tell you that you will find them good or useful.

example.ex: I can commend it to him as a realistic course of action.
example.tran: 我可以把这作为一个切实可行的处理方法推荐给他。

entry.def: If something commends itself to you, you approve of it.

example.ex: The Rousseau model commended itself to a lot of early socialists.
example.tran: 卢梭提出的模式被很多早期的社会主义者接受。

entry.def: If you say that something has much to commend it, you approve of it. If you say that something has little to commend it, you disapprove of it.

example.ex: The Prime Minister's initiative has much to commend it.
example.tran: 首相的新方案有不少令人赞许之处。

means.word_mean: 2. present as worthy of regard, kindness, or confidence;

sentences.sentence: "His paintings commend him to the artistic world"

means.word_mean: 5. mention as by way of greeting or to indicate friendship;

auth_sentence.content: We must commend the government of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf.
auth_sentence.res_content: We must commend the government of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We must commend the government of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf.

auth_sentence.content: This only served to further commend her to the locals.
auth_sentence.res_content: This only served to further commend her to the locals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This only served to further commend her to the locals.

auth_sentence.content: I commend the Chimes for doing it the right way.
auth_sentence.res_content: I commend the Chimes for doing it the right way.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I commend the Chimes for doing it the right way.

Sentence.sentence: Schweitzer concedes his research runs counter to a very large body of literature that commends the many benefits of goal-setting.

sentences.en: The teacher often commends good students.
The dying man commended his soul to God.
sentences.cn: 那个将死的人把自己的灵魂托付给上帝。

jushi.english: The teacher often commends good students and good deeds.
jushi.chinese: 老师常常表扬好人好事。
他的工作受到高度赞扬。

jushi.english: Our shop has always been highly commended.
jushi.chinese: 我们的商店一直受到人们的高度赞扬。
